EmailTemplate.subject: Unlocking the full potential of virtual care for your employees
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
JOIN OUR CHAT The future of care: Is your virtual care strategy meeting employee expectations?
April 26 | 2:00 PM Eastern Image Businessman using tablet Virtual care has proven its ability to keep members healthy when in-person visits aren’t convenient or safe, and employers are taking notice. In the next three years, 70% of employers we surveyed expect to have fully implemented, or be close to implementing, a whole-person virtual care strategy. 1 Are you keeping pace?
Join Stephanie DeLorm, Senior Vice President of Health Solutions at Aon, and Kim Lafontana, Senior Vice President of Solutions Strategy at Teladoc Health, as they sit down to discuss redesigning care delivery that unlocks the full potential of virtual care to keep employees healthy and happy—today, tomorrow and beyond.
Register now <[[https://www.benefitnews.com/web-seminars/the-future-of-care-is-your-virtual-care-strategy-meeting-employee-expectations?utm_source=dg_teladochealth&utm_medium=webseminar&utm_campaign=dg_ebn_teladochealth_webseminar_04262022]]>
Topics will include: How virtual care creates greater health equity Ever-changing consumer expectations and how to meet them Retaining top talent with better benefits Integrated, long-term solutions for whole-person care Speakers
Stephanie DeLorm Senior Vice President, Health Solutions Aon
Kim Lafontana Senior Vice President, Solutions Strategy Teladoc Health 1 Virtual Care Transformation Study of Large Employers, Teladoc Health, 2021
